response: "I feel like I have to constantly live up to unrealistic standards set by society."
"It's like I'm expected to be perfect in every aspect of my life and it's becoming too much to handle."
"I'm trying my best to fit in and be accepted, but it's like the goalposts keep moving."
"I'm starting to feel like I'm losing myself in this constant pursuit of perfection."
"I don't even know what's real anymore. Is this really what's expected of me?"
"I feel like I'm not good enough, no matter what I do."
"It's like I'm trapped in this cycle of comparison and self-doubt."
"I don't know how to escape this pressure and just be happy with who I am."
"I'm exhausted from trying to be perfect all the time. When does it end?"
"I just wish society would accept me for who I am instead of constantly pushing me to be someone I'm not."
